description: It's a short switchback trail that leads from the lookout to the mouth of the beach and view of the Pololu Valley.Humidity is likely to be 100% this is a rain forest area, and temperature will likely be 30 C. Trail can be slippery when wet.The views of the north coast of the Big Island are superb.It was also one of the few trails we found in the Big Island that didn't involve ankle twisting lava.
directions: Follow the north Kohala region's main highway 270 to it's dead end. Trail starts from the parking area.
title: Pololu Valley
